childnodes.sy: Located inside the Essex Street Market, Shopsin’s serves a legendary mac and cheese pancake that is perfectly salty, sweet and crisp around the edges, along with other crazy-decadent delicacies like donut sliders.

There is one thing you must get at Alchemy and that is the toad in a hole: a hollowed-out piece of bread filled with egg and topped with cream, dill and tomatoes. Wash it down with a fresh-squeezed orange juice…and then wash that down with a beer.

The aptly named Tasty Dumpling is rumored to have the best dumplings in all of Manhattan. Order five pork and chive dumplings for just $1.25. If they weren’t so greasy, you might end up eating them for every meal.

Whether you top your toasted-everything bagel with tofu scallion cream cheese or bacon, eggs and cheese, you can count on Terrace to serve the best bagels in Brooklyn. Prospect Park is just a block away.

Get your nosh on at Lower East Side institution Russ and Daughters. Try a bagel topped with pastrami-smoked salmon and an insanely good salted caramel macaroon for dessert. You can also get your specialty candies, jewel-toned lox, and fancy caviar.

Is Egg Shop in Nolita all it’s cracked up to be? See for yourself when you order the Spandex, a bowl of miso quinoa, pickled vegetables, avocado and a poached egg, along with yummy smashed avocado toast. It all tastes supremely fresh and healthy.

You’ve got to order the renowned pancakes if it’s your first time having breakfast at Clinton Street, but try the specials on subsequent visits – decadent options like the crab cake eggs Benedict and apple pie waffle won’t disappoint.
